objective: Identify and list all geometric properties of the hexagon ABCDEF, including convexity, equilateral nature, and parallel opposite sides. Explain how these properties influence the geometric configuration of the hexagon.
supporting_info: The hexagon is defined as a convex equilateral figure where all pairs of opposite sides are parallel, which implies specific symmetry and geometric relationships.

objective: Determine the geometric relationship between the hexagon and the triangle formed by the extensions of AB, CD, and EF. Explore how the given side lengths of the triangle (200, 240, and 300) relate to the dimensions of the hexagon.
supporting_info: This subtask builds on the properties identified in Sub-task 1.1. The side lengths of the triangle must be analyzed alongside the characteristics of the hexagon to derive meaningful geometric relationships.

objective: Calculate the side length of the hexagon using the relationships and dimensions identified from the previous subtasks.
supporting_info: This subtask relies on the conclusions drawn from Sub-task 1.2 regarding the relationship between the triangle and the hexagon, particularly how the triangle's defined side lengths constrain or inform the possible dimensions of the hexagon.
